result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

**updated per email from Attorney Sonderhouse (mjs)
Hearing on December 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to have no contact with the Victim A/Witness A/individuals listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 0.5 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent. Defendant to pay costs associated with GPS monitoring.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

Attorney Sonderhouse makes statements to the court.
Court orders the defendant become compliant by noon on Friday, November 4, 2022.  Court sets cash bail of $1000

02:07 PM Defendant Bradley S Hines in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  The Court puts the defendant on notice that if this Court receives a letter that GPS monitoring is turned off or if defendant goes within exclusion zone, the Court will immediately issue a warrant for the defendants arrest.
